title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 571.3 - Traffic regulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 571.3 - Traffic regulations

State Regulations
(a) Operation of vehicles on or off campus must conform with all State and
municipal regulations as well as college regulations. The Vehicle and Traffic

Law shall apply upon such premises notwithstanding any reference in such law to
public highways, streets, roads, or sidewalks. (b) A complaint regarding any violation of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law or any traffic ordinance applicable on such
premises shall be processed in accordance with the requirements of applicable
law. All violations other than parking are handled through uniform traffic
tickets, which are answerable to the Village Justice, Village of

Canton. (c) The speed limit on all
college roads is as posted. No person shall drive a vehicle on university
streets, roads or highways at a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent
under the conditions and having regard to the actual and potential hazards then
existing, but in no event shall a person drive a vehicle in excess of 30 miles
per hour unless a different speed is authorized and indicated by the
university. (d) All vehicles are
excluded from all pedestrian walkways, except service and emergency vehicles
specifically authorized by the chief of university police, or
designee. (e) The following
roadways are designated for one-way traffic: (1)

The southerly Cooper Service Complex Exit

Drive for traffic proceeding in a westerly direction only. (2)

The easterly driveway from parking lot 1
for traffic proceeding in a southerly direction only. (3)

The easterly driveway from parking lot 3
for traffic proceeding in a northerly direction only. (f) The following roadways are designated as
stop intersections with the erection of stop signs as indicated below: Intersection of
